column11:
first steps to electronic communication with public bodies is regulated by an 
E-Government Act

Electronic counting regulated in law on automatic voting; 
digital transmission of counted ballots, results & protocols

source only partly translated, therefore keyword search including greek translations: 
device (syskeví), digital (psifiakó), electronic (ilektronikós), internet (Diadíktyo), machine (michaní), online (Se sýndesi)

electronic voting on all levels: 
municipal council election, national parliament and european parliament election
electoral rolls may be delivered in electronic form

electoral law regulates both kinds of voting: "by voting machine and electronic postal voting"
use of following keywords, since the law is only available in french:
device (appareil), digital (digital/numérique), electronic (électronique), internet, online (en ligne), machine

Federal Election Law and European Election Act (EuWG) allow for use of 
voting machines, jurisdiction of Federal Constitutional Court (BVerfG) requires adjustment
use of original legislative text therefore following keywords:
device (Gerät), digital, electronic (elektronisch), internet, machine (Maschine), online

use of following keywords, since the law is only available in french:
device (appareil), digital (digital/numérique), electronic (électronique), internet, online (en ligne), machine
Uses Electronic Counting Systems for paper ballots
"Voting takes place by means of official ballots." (Art. 40)
Computer system for monitoring turnout and preventing illegal voting (electronic electoral register)
"Secret voting shall be conducted on ballot papers" (Art. 9)

column5: e-voting discussed on local and regional levels
e-voting paused due to amendements in vernehmlassung
